newsitem.title: CHINA: Gore raises human rights issues with China.
newsitem.headline: Gore raises human rights issues with China.

text.p: U.S. Vice President Al Gore said on Wednesday the U.S. side had raised specific cases of human rights problems with Chinese leaders during his visit to Beijing this week.
"Specific names were raised during the course of my visit," Gore told a news conference.
However, he did not identify any dissidents who were mentioned by him or any other U.S. officials in talks since he arrived in China on Monday evening.
The Chinese were more receptive to the U.S. position than they had been in the past, he said.

Asked by reporters how he had reached that conclusion, he said the more receptive response was reflected in "the language that was used, the muted tone of the response" compared with their reaction in the past.
China maintains that human rights are its own internal affairs and routinely rebuffs criticism of its rights record.
